entry.div:
Casting
The
Germans
use
lead from
Flanders
because it is very soft. And to cast better they take
lead ore
& melt it, & separate what is melted from the
filth
&
ore
, & pour it into a separate
vessel
, then
the bottom
they make their cast with it. For the
lead
must not have been put to work before, but rather completely new. Some cast into
molds of
iron
&
copper
.
or new
lead
coming from the
mine
. They melt it twice in a
crucible
. In the first one, they purge it of
filth
. In the second, they
en
make the cast.
